column2: UPDATE 1-FERC approves Ameren's sale of Illinois coal plants to Dynegy Oct 14 U.S. federal energy regulators approved power company Ameren Corp's plan to sell five coal-fired power plants in Illinois to power generator Dynegy Inc

Delaware judge lifts veil covering Al Jazeera-AT&T; case Oct 14 Al Jazeera must unseal its lawsuit against AT&T; Inc within five business days after a Delaware judge sided on Monday with news organizations that objected to secrecy in the case. ~
Boeing rebuts critical Pentagon report on helicopter parts WASHINGTON
column3: Oct 14 Boeing Co on Monday rebutted a Pentagon's inspector general report that said the company overcharged the U.S. Army by up to $16.6 million on a $4.4 billion helicopter contract and said it was still waiting to receive the final report under a Freedom of Information Act request. ~

column2: Ford's Russia venture adds new SUV model MOSCOW
column4: a joint venture between U.S. automaker Ford Motor Co and Russian carmaker Sollers
column5: is adding a new SUV model to its range to meet growing local demand. ~

column2: Peugeot shares slump on report of capital talks with Dongfeng
column4: Oct 14 Shares in PSA Peugeot Citroen  fell 10 percent on Monday on a Reuters report it was preparing a 3-billion-euro ($4.1 billion) capital increase in which Chinese partner Dongfeng and the French state would secure stakes in it. ~

column2: Macy's stores to open on U.S. Thanksgiving for first time NEW YORK
column3: Oct 14 Macy's Inc said on Monday that most of its stores will open on the U.S. Thanksgiving Day holiday for the first time in its history
column4: in a sign of how competitive the holiday season is shaping up. ~

column2: Roche to spend $880 million on manufacturing
column3: create 500 jobs ZURICH Swiss drugmaker Roche is to invest 800 million Swiss francs ($880 million) in its global manufacturing facilities over the next five years
column5: as it prepares for growing demand for its biologic medicines. ~
